description: This trap is generated if a MAC/User is dropped due to vlan not existing or UNP is not enabled on the MCLAG

event.Summary: MAC/User is dropped due to vlan not existing or UNP is not enabled on the MCLAG

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::unpMcLagMacIgnored ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpMacAddr s EXAMPL ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpSourceIpAddr a 192.0.2.1 ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpNativeVlan i 9999 ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpVlan i 1 ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpMCLAGId i 9999

description: The mac which failed to get configured on peer chassis.
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpMacAddr

description: The ip-address of mac which failed to get configured on peer chassis.
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpSourceIpAddr

description: The native vlan of MCLAG on which the mac ingressed.
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpNativeVlan

description: The vlan on which mac was classified on local chassis
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpVlan

description: This trap is generated when configuration becomes Out_of_Sync.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::unpMcLagConfigInconsistency ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpCommandType i 1 ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpName s EXAMPLE ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpMacAddr1 s EXAMPL ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpMacAddr2 s EXAMPL ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpIpAddr a 192.0.2.1 ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpIpMask s EXAMPLE ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpVlanTag i 0 ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpMCLAGId i 9999

description: Indicates which configuration command is out-of-sync
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpCommandType

description: Indicates which unp profile is out-of-sync. If there is no UNP Profile
associated then zero length string is sent
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpName

description: The mac for mac rule or the lower limit of mac-range rule.
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpMacAddr1

description: The upper limit of mac-range rule.
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpMacAddr2

description: The vlan vlan-tag rule. Zero value means it is not applicable
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-DA-MIB::alaDaUnpVlanTag
